ingredients_all: 2 slices bacon, crispy and cut in strips
pantry_recipes_collection.preparation: Tear corner of Ready Pasta pouch to vent, heat in microwave for one minute; pour on a plate and let cool down. Toss pasta with all ingredients together in individual-sized serving bowls.

pantry_recipes_collection.recipe_name: Pasta Salad with Tomato Basil Sauce and Cheese
ingredients_all: 1 cup of Barilla Tomato & Basil Sauce
pantry_recipes_collection.preparation: Tear corner of Ready Pasta pouch to vent, heat for 60 seconds in the microwave. Warm sauce and basil in a bowl for 2 minutes in the microwave. Combine pasta with sauce and top with cheese.

ingredients_all: ⅓ cup of Parmesan cheese or Cotija
Chile powder or Hot Cheetos powder
pantry_recipes_collection.preparation: Start by adding the butter to a frying pan. Add the corn kernels and cook for 5 minutes over medium heat. Serve in cups. Add cheese, mayonnaise on top, and finish with chili powder or Hot Cheetos powder. Eat as is, or mix. Enjoy!

ingredients_all: ⅛ cup of white or red onion
ingredients_at_pantry: ⅛ cup of white or red onion
pantry_recipes_collection.preparation: Open the canned tuna. Drain the liquid from the canned tuna. Add the tuna to the bowl. Wash your tomatoes, cucumber, and onion. Chop the tomatoes, cucumber, and onion into small cubes. Wash and drain your cilantro and roughly chop the cilantro. Add the chopped tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and cilantro into the same bowl as the tuna. Add lemon or lime juice to the bowl. You may add mayonnaise if you want, and add the sea salt. Carefully mix your ingredients together. Can be eaten right away or stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator.
Preheat the oven to 400°F. Cook pasta according to the packaging instructions on the stovetop. Coat the casserole dish with oil. Combine all ingredients in the casserole dish.

Preheat the oven to 425°F. Slice peppers into quarters. Mix tuna and mayonnaise. Combine all ingredients into a casserole dish. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven, top with cheese. Bake for another ~3 minutes. No cheese? Use dairy-free cheese.

ingredients_all: Spices: Garlic powder, Onion powder, Smoked paprika, Cayenne pepper, Za'atar, Salt, Pepper, Dill seasoning
pantry_recipes_collection.preparation: Prepare by opening and draining cans of tuna and chickpeas. Lightly mash tuna after draining. Dice red onions. Drizzle olive oil in a bowl and toss in chickpeas to cover in oil. Mix in garlic powder, onion powder, smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, za'atar, salt and pepper. Add tuna and lightly mix it in the bowl. Top with arugula. Squeeze lemon juice and add dill seasoning. Toss salad and your quick meal is ready!

ingredients_all: ½ hot pepper, deseeded and finely chopped
2 bell peppers, deseeded and finely chopped
ingredients_at_pantry: ½ hot pepper, deseeded and finely chopped
2 bell peppers, deseeded and finely chopped
pantry_recipes_collection.preparation: In a large skillet, heat 1 tbsp of canola oil and sesame oil over medium-high heat. Add eggs and stir until cooked through. Set aside the eggs, wipe the skillet, and add remaining canola oil. Add onion, ginger, garlic, both hot pepper and bell peppers, broccoli, and cooked rice. Increase heat slightly and cook until rice is crispy (about 5 minutes). In a small bowl, combine oyster sauce with soy sauce. Pour mixture over rice and continue cooking until the rice has absorbed the liquid. Add cooked eggs back into the skillet and mix. Serve.

Thoroughly wash bok choy and separate sprigs. Rinse broccoli and green beans. Chop up chicken breast into bite-sized pieces. Chop up shallots. Heat up oil in a large pot and throw in shallots and thai chilis. Cook for a few minutes until shallots starts to brown. Add panang curry paste/sauce and coconut milk. Add chicken and broth. Simmer for 10-12 minutes. Add broccoli, green beans, and bok choy. Cook for 5 minutes. Serve with rice!

ingredients_all: 1 ½ cups of shredded Mexican cheese
pantry_recipes_collection.preparation: Preheat oven to 350°F. Cook ground turkey, add chili, salt, cheese, tomatoes, and green onions. Cut tops off peppers and remove seeds. Cut peppers in half, coat with oil, and roast for 5 mins until skin blisters. Stuff peppers with the chili filling.
Heat oil, add leeks and cook until soft. Add turnips and cook until translucent. Stir in garlic. Add stock, salt, bay leaf, and rice. Boil, then simmer covered for 30 minutes.
Cook rice and mix with seasoning. Cut vegetables into matchsticks. Cut nori in half. Spoon rice onto one half of the nori, top with vegetables, and roll.
Bake pricked eggplants at 400°F for 30-35 mins. Sauté scallions, mushrooms, and garlic. Add spices and tomatoes; simmer. Mash eggplant flesh and add to pan with cilantro. Simmer 5 mins.

ingredients_all: Vinaigrette: orange juice, olive oil, dijon mustard, apple cider vinegar, poppyseeds, honey
pantry_recipes_collection.preparation: Add spinach to a bowl and layer seeds, pear, feta, and pecans on top. For vinaigrette: shake all ingredients in a jar and drizzle over salad. Toss and serve.

ingredients_all: ¼ cup half and half milk
Salt and ground pepper to taste
ingredients_at_pantry: Salt and ground pepper to taste
pantry_recipes_collection.preparation: Sauté garlic in oil on low for 40 mins. Brown pork chops in same pan. Cook spaghetti, reserving 1 cup water. Blend garlic and milk into a paste. Combine paste, butter, and pasta water in a pan. Toss pasta with red peppers and garlic mixture in the pork pan.
Cook orzo. Melt butter until browned. Sauté spinach and garlic for 1 min. Stir in orzo, cheese, broth, vinegar, salt, and red pepper.

pantry_recipes_collection.recipe_name: Udon With Chicken and Garlicky Peanut Dressing
ingredients_all: ¼ cup natural creamy peanut butter
ingredients_at_pantry: ¼ cup natural creamy peanut butter
pantry_recipes_collection.preparation: Whisk dressing ingredients. Cook udon and rinse under cold water. Toss noodles, chicken, celery, sprouts, and daikon with dressing. Top with sesame seeds and chili oil.
Roast sliced tomatoes with seasoning at 375°F for 15-20 mins. Mash avocados with lime juice. Toast bread, spread avocado, top with roasted tomatoes, balsamic glaze, and garnish.

pantry_recipes_collection.recipe_name: Corn Salad with Radishes, Jalapeno, and Lime
pantry_recipes_collection.preparation: Chop radishes, jalapeno, and cilantro. Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Season with salt to taste.
Sauté onions in butter. Add chopped vegetables. Pour in broth, boil, and simmer for 40 mins. Puree until smooth.
Melt butter, cook cumin and mustard seeds until popping. Add rice and squash. Add water and salt; boil. Cover and cook on low for 15 mins. Let stand for 5 mins, then fluff.

pantry_recipes_collection.recipe_name: Chicken, Sweet Potato, and Black Bean Skillet
ingredients_all: Spices: cumin, chili powder, oregano, garlic, pepper
ingredients_at_pantry: ¼ tsp of granulated garlic and pepper
pantry_recipes_collection.preparation: Sauté chicken with half the spices. Add onion. Add remaining spices, sweet potato, tomatoes, beans, chilis, and salsa. Cook 2-3 mins. Add lime juice and cheese; cover to melt. Garnish with cilantro.
Combine all ingredients in a pot; boil, then simmer covered for 25-35 minutes. Add cream and heat through.

pantry_recipes_collection.recipe_name: Okra and Chickpeas in Fresh Tomato Sauce
pantry_recipes_collection.preparation: Sauté onion and garlic. Add tomatoes, cumin, harissa, and lemon; cook 5 mins. Add okra, salt, and pepper; cover and cook 10 mins. Stir in chickpeas for 3 mins. Add parsley.
Sauté onion and garlic in butter/oil. Add salt, pepper, and flour. Whisk in broth, tomatoes, paste, sugar, and basil. Simmer 20 mins. Blend until smooth, add cream, and cook 5 more mins.
Boil rice with bay leaves and water. Simmer 18 mins. Let rest 10 mins. Remove bay leaves, stir in lime, lemon, salt, and cilantro.

Wash moringa leaves. Combine leaves, coconut, turmeric, and salt. Sauté mustard seeds and shallots in oil. Add chilies and curry leaves. Mix in moringa mixture, cover and cook 10 mins. Cook uncovered for 2 mins.
